choices.E: Change the trusted sites in the browser settings.
choices.B: Change the security settings of the email client.
choices.A: Change the email settings in antivirus.

questions.question_text:
A user is experiencing email problems and explains to a technician that all emails with graphics or images do not display the graphics.
Which of the following configurations would correct this behavior?

comments.content: Imagine you just received an email on AOL. You click on the email and all you see is a blank white box followed by text. You can tell there is supposed to be more in the email, but for some reason it isn't appearing. At the top of the screen, you see a yellow ticker bar that states, "Would you like to download the content of this email?". Once you click "accept", all the images within the email begin to appear. This is what the question is referring to, this is a security setting within the email client. You can change the setting to allow it to download the contents of the email automatically, however, this is not recommended as it is a security risk.
Great point! Also, you can configure the security settings for hosted images in Microsoft outlook with the Trust Center Settings

discussion.content: I don't think MOST really UNDERSTAND these questions!!!
It is because image/graphics are used for tracking purpose by malicious website, disabling them allow to keep security/confidentiality.

comments.content: It could have security settings stopping inappropriate images/graphics showing i suppose

discussion.content: What does the security settings have to do with the image and or graphics?

Selected Answer: B
its online not local
I believe I/O bandwidth is correct. A cloud sync application requires a high amount of I/O bandwidth to read and write a large amount of data.
is the most
I/O bandwidth is a weird answer. Yes its the one that is correct/makes the most sense but They couldve just put "network connectivity", which is the real correct answer.

comments.content: I beg to differ. Network connectivity is nice and all, but when your I/O has a lower bandwidth than the network, it ain't gonna do much and just bottleneck your server.
Well, you need network connectivity to sync in the first place. That why it is important to have high I/O bandwidth for faster and efficient cloud file storage sync.
I don't think MOST of you reading these questions, really UNDERSTAND what you are reading!!! Reading COMPREHENSION is KEY to answering these question effectively.

discussion.content: correct answer.. makes sense if you need to sync files to the cloud, you need internet to do that

questions.question_text: Which of the following resources is the MOST critical when using cloud file-storage synchronization applications?

A user logs on a PC and receives a message stating there is a duplicate IP address on the network. After a system restart, the user notices the same error.
Which of the following is the MOST probable cause of the error?

choices.C: The user has moved to a different office.
choices.B: The user has set a static IP address.
choices.A: The user is still logged into another device.
choices.D: The user has wireless and wired connections.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
the user restarted meaning the ip didnt change

comments.content: do not overcomplicate things, you log in and have IP conflict, you restarted and still have error meaning your IP didn't change.

discussion.content: uhmmm.. seems simple but I don't have all info I require: could be C. the answer do not tells me if there's a DHCP on the prsent network... so the user can be move from one office using static IP to another office .
Even though he set a static IP, he did not reserve the IP in the DHCP pool so another device got assigned that IP.

most likely the DHCP server already assigned the IP address to another device on the network, and the computer is set to the IP address of one of the devices which in turn you would get duplicate error. To fix this change the computer network setting to DHCP. answer is right
Answer D is funny, could just imagine the technician removing the motherboard and wait 10 minutes next to it praying for the issue to be fixed ^^

Selected Answer: C
rmoving cmos will reset bios and eufi

the answer according to CompTIA is to clear the CMOS by removing the battery for ten seconds, because obviously the CompTIA test makers have never cleared the CMOS before. In the real world, everyone knows you don't touch the battery for that. That's what the CLR jumper is for.

A "Supervisor Password" locks or unlocks access to the system setup utility (CMOS setup). 
A "User Password" locks or unlocks the computer booting to an operating system.

You can either log in to CMOS and disable the password protection or remove ( and place back after a few seconds) CMOS battery to revert everything back to default.
I do not understand solution? Can someone explain please...

comments.content: In BIOS/UEFI settings you can set password before boot, but you can remove the set password by remove the CMOS battery.

Basically, a CMOS is where your BIOS/UEFI settings are stored. However, it is volatile, meaning that once it loses power, the settings are gone. Removing the CMOS battery (or pressing the designated CMOS button that most motherboards have today) will reset the BIOS/UEFI settings, thus removing the password lock.

questions.question_text:
Whenever a user's machine is turned on, a black screen appears prompting the user for an administrative password. The technician has no such password on file for this machine.
Which of the following steps should the technician take to resolve this issue?

choices.B: Disconnect and reconnect the internal hard drive.
choices.C: Remove the CMOS battery and reinsert it after ten seconds.
choices.D: Remove the motherboard and place it back into the machine after ten minutes.
choices.A: Press and hold the CPU power button for five seconds, and then power back on.

questions.question_text: A server administrator set up a VM to be used in a lab setting. A technician is setting up thin-client computers to access this VM. Which of the following tasks are required to complete the project? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
The scenario itself if fine, the question you are right is a bit stupid...

In my opinion the question is not clear if we are asked what is needed from Admin/VM perspective to complete the task OR what is needed from technician/Thin client perspective.

If it is the thin client perspective I'm not sure if installing application is his task. And finally if connecting mouse and keyboard is one correct taks why not connecting the monitor. A thinclient with keyboard and mouse, net access but without monitor is useless.

If the focus is on the admin, it should be OS installing, Application and system updates.

Any thoughts/comments?
Looks like the answers target the server; all are in singular, not plural for thin-client computers (plural). Tricky, no?
the focus is to access this VM, so you need C D G to access the VM, which are keyboard, mouse, monitor and network.

discussion.content: stupid stupid question, makes no sense

CDG -- The last thing mentioned in the question is “A technician is setting up thin-client computers.” Thin clients require a mouse, keyboard, monitor, and a network connection to the VM host. So need the following:
C. Install a USB keyboard and mouse. 
D. Connect the device to the network. 
G. Connect the device to a monitor.
CORRECT ANSWER IS EFH
you need a KVM for anything server related with Comptia

Yes very simple question but worng answers... C D G are correct: Admin is settings up a thin client, wich has an embedded system, and it has no HDD... so... you just need hardware to connect to an hypervisor running VM inside. Apps, OS and printers are inside the VM not in the thin client!

The Server Admin already SETUP the VM, so, we are talking about the 3 things the tech should do. Would the client side tech insall system updates and apps? Or just setup the then client? If I get this question on the exam, I am going with C, D, and G. All those things have to be done even if its up to the tech to install the apps and updates next.
so, I know some thin clients have an OS, but mostly it's just a hardware version of a browser. So, I did chose C, D, and G. Based on that assumption
The correct answers are: Connect the device to the network, Install the latest system updates, Install the necessary applications
The answer should be C,D and G

The thing that makes me see why DEH would be correct instead of CDG, is that they don't just say 'A technician is setting up thin clients', it's specifically 'to access this VM'. So the hardware part- C and G- don't seem to be the focus; it's specifically the tasks needed for the task of connecting them to the VM, which would be DEH. Absurd question though, what is the point of these questions with multiple correct answers and vague wording...

Does anyone know for sure if they're talking about the thin clients or the VM? 
To me it seems like the VM has already been set up, while they refer to the set up of the thin clients in present tense.
if its a thin client the apps are server based right ?
I think since the admin already "set up" (past tense) his vm, and the tech is in the process of "setting up" (present tense), it would be cdg the hardware needed for the thin clients

answer is CDG..... lets break the question into two sessions, firs one is the duty of the admin the second the duty of the technician, 
1. the admin rolls out patches, updates, installs OS, installs the drivers and all that reguarly per system policy. 
2. the technnician, THIN CLIENT is the most convenient and cheapest VMachine out there today, for a user (eg the lab scientist) to make use of it they would need monitor, keyboard, mouse installed and also network accessibility to be able to make use of the Virtual desktop. 
i hope this answers it.
C, D and G are correct

This question in hardware part, so I think an server administrator has already installed OS and apps on VM.
A technician only should physically connect all devices and check VM is working.
My answer - C, D, G

1st off I would install the OS make sure I had the latest drivers and patches then install any apps. Since the clients are thin apps would reside on server and only results would be sent back to client.

choices.D: Connect the device to the network.
choices.C: Install a USB keyboard and mouse.
choices.A: Connect the device to a printer.
choices.G: Connect the device to a monitor.
